Dear KAYLA R MCCLOUD:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
5/9/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (d) Three references obtained from persons
who are unrelated to the staff person.
Two of Fifteen employee files reviewed contained references not obtained as
required. All three references were obtained after hire for one employee and one
reference was obtained after hire for the other.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
• (2) The personnel record must contain all the
following information before employment may
occur:
• (h) Documentation from the department
that the person has not been named in a
central registry case as the perpetrator of
child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in any
state where the person lived in the 5 years
preceding hire.
2

One of Fifteen employee files reviewed did not contain a child abuse registry
clearance from the state the employee lived in prior to hire. Upon discovering this,
the agency Director immediately put a plan into place to ensure the employee did
not have unsupervised contact with children in care. The clearance has since been
received.
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
• (3) An agency shall provide the licensee with an
application for renewal of the license and
document the action not less than 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. A
renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending
recommendation for disciplinary action of the
license.
One of Three open foster home files reviewed contained documentation of the foster
parent being provided a renewal application less than 60 day prior to the license
expiring.
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (4) An agency shall document placement
specifications consistent with the information
contained in the reevaluation. The placement
specifications must include all of the following:
• (a) The age, number, SOGIE, race, ethnic
background, and characteristics of children
preferred by the applicant.
One of Three open foster home files reviewed contained a foster home evaluation
report that did not specify the SOGIE of children the family was willing to accept.
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
• (1) An agency's medical and dental care policy
must include all the following:
• (f) A dental re-examination must be
obtained at least every 9 months, unless a
greater frequency is indicated.
3

One of Three open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
documentation of any dental examinations.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (3) When case responsibility changes from 1 child
placing agency to another child placing agency, a
modified service plan must be completed within 30
calendar days of the change in agency
responsibility if no other plan is done within 30
days. The plan must address why the agency
responsibility changed and whether there are any
modifications to existing service plans.
One of Three open files of youths in foster care placements reviewed did not contain
a modified service plan documenting the reason for the change in agency and any
modifications to the existing service plan.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Employee orientation documentation must include the number of hours as
well as the dates the orientation topics were completed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Reminder as there have been several staffing changes including the
majority of the leadership team; All staff and foster parents must have training in
Trauma Informed Parenting, Human Trafficking, Systemic Racism, SOGIE, and
Agency Expectations. Rule 400.12209(2)(a) and Rule 400.12312 (3).
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The one
CAP submitted during the period under review was in response to the 5/7/2024
4

licensing inspection report. That CAP was approved on 6/3/2024 and addressed
12 violations. Five of those violations were related to MDHHS policy requirements
which are no longer regulated by DCWL. The remaining 7 violations were related
to licensing requirements. All of those violations were adequately addressed
through the CAP as evidenced by successful CAP compliance verification over a
6-month review period and a lack of repeat violations during the 2025 inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator indicated there has been a lot of staff turnover during the
period under review, including the majority of the leadership team. The chief
administrator identified several new processes, meetings, tracking methods, and
workgroups implemented following the last inspection which has resulted in an
increase in rule compliance.
Financial Overview
Reviewed annual financial audit report and no financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
The staff members interviewed indicated, despite the changes over the past year,
they have felt supported and encouraged in their job responsibilities. They feel
there has been an increase in transparency and communication since a new
director has been appointed which has led to an increased feeling of stability and
support.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office appears to have adequate space and equipment to provide for
the delivery of foster home certification, foster care, adoption, and independent
living services. The files are stored securely in a locking file room preventing
unauthorized access. Physical CHRI is stored in a separate location within a
locked office along with the cross shredder.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
